doc:
L. Frank Baum https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L._Frank_Baum 0 Lyman Frank Baum (; May 15, 1856 – May 6, 1919) was an American author chiefly famous for his children's books, particularly The Wonderful Wizard of Oz and its sequels. He wrote a total of 14 novels in the Oz series, plus 41 other novels, 83 short stories, over 200 poems, and at least 42 scripts. He made numerous attempts to bring his works to the stage and the nascent medium of film; the 1939 adaptation of the first Oz book would become a landmark of 20th-century cinema. His works anticipated such century-later commonplaces as television, augmented reality, laptop computers (The Master Key), wireless telephones (Tik-Tok of Oz), women in high-risk and action-heavy occupations (Mary Louise in the Country), police corruption and false evidence (Phoebe Daring), and the ubiquity of advertising on clothing (Aunt Jane's Nieces at Work). Lyman_Frank_Baum ( ; May_15_,_1856 – May_6_,_1919 ) was an_American_author chiefly_famous for his_children 's_books , particularly The_Wonderful_Wizard of Oz and its_sequels . His_works anticipated such_century-later_commonplaces as television , augmented reality , laptop_computers ( The_Master_Key_) , wireless_telephones_(_Tik-Tok of Oz_) , women in high-risk_and_action-heavy_occupations ( Mary_Louise in the_Country_) , police_corruption and false_evidence ( Phoebe_Daring_) , and the_ubiquity of advertising on clothing_(_Aunt_Jane 's_Nieces at Work_) .
